discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #11

content.content: This weekly post has the ambition to summarize what’s been going on in the Gitcoin DAO Governance. Topics, ideas, proposals, and votes will be listed with links for further reading and discussion. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance   The discussion on Gitcoin Round 11 Matching Pool Allocations has been ongoing with comments, ideas and suggestions from the Stewards and community. The vote on Snapshot to ratify the allocations proposed by _​:fire: has been ratified. The proposal to issue a 40k GTC grant to CLR.fund has been ratified. The Monthly Steward Call happened Monday. Agenda and notes provided by @Anett. After a discussion in the Monthly Steward Call @owocki authored a thread raising the question: What are the KPIs that GitcoinDAO Optimizes for? @Toby commented with some suggestions for trackable, quantified KPIs.  @Toby raised some questions in the Gitcoin Treasury Vision thread regarding a treasury management plan and strategy. The second Steward Unconference Chat this week by @Anett. The goal of these calls is to “meet stewards & friends and have non formal chats together, share memes and chat about whatever we want.”  DAOs - The New Coordination Frontier - a comprehensive report on DAO creators curated by GitcoinDAO and BanklessDAO has been published by @owocki. Key takeaways can be found in the thread on Twitter.  @codingsh authored a thread to discuss the formation of a DAO focused on our mental health.   🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion  Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management  Formal discussions on deploying the first workstream budget are set to take shape on Monday! Join the call here  The treasury management doc by @HelloShreyas is still up for discussion, please leave comments! Judging for the public goods RFP continues with some excellent submissions so far, set to close out next week! The public library is starting to evolve into a group not only researching public goods, but helping to bring new DAOs into the fold, making a moral case for their support in the mission A grantee success squad is starting to spin up to make sure new and returning grantees are getting the most out of the platform  Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective)  The transaction from the Gitcoin DAO treasury towards funding for the Moonshot Collective Workstream has been executed on-chain!  Decentralization Workstream  UI designs continue to be implemented and we are on track for POC completion this week Discussions have begun around utilization of L2s in order to keep gas costs down Contract audit is in progress and we will have results by the end of this week Curation game hackathon entry has been completed and we will be picking winners by the end of next week Documentation project is kicking off now and will result in a base level of documentation and explainers for dGrants   Fraud Detection & Defense (FDD-WG)   The transaction from the Gitcoin DAO treasury towards funding for the Fraud Detection & Defence Workstream has been executed on-chain! With Gitcoin Grants Rounds 11 launched this week @DisruptionJoe authored a thread on GR11 - Grants Disputes & Policy Conversation to keep a public record of all the disputes.  @php authored a thread with the title FDD ML - data thoughts with thoughts on “Reporting & Analytics, Data Operation/privacy and ML”.  Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream  A couple of sub-streams have been formed under the MMM-Workstream as branches of MMM have grown and to improve the onboarding process. Current sub-streams and operational leads are: Design - @fred Tech/dev @sidcode Socials @angel-fire Events @hapob Writing - tbc A Gitcoin DAO newsletter is being created to highlight interesting developments and conversations in the community as well as keep the community informed on upcoming events.  That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance. Feel free to join the discussions via the links above and on Discord, and visit the Gitcoin DAO Event calendar to keep yourself updated on what’s to come! Previous Edition

discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #6

content.content: This weekly post has the ambition to summarise what’s been going on in the Gitcoin DAO Governance. Topics, ideas, proposals, and votes will be listed with links for further reading and discussion. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance    The third Gitcoin Monthly Steward sync was held on August 2. @Anett provided the agenda and notes from the call. A recording is coming through soon!   The DAO calendar continues to be updated with relevant workstream events, if you see anything missing please suggest it!   @Anett proposed an initiative that was brought up on the Stewards call #3: “The idea to host unconference sessions is to meet stewards & friends and have informal chats together, share memes, share whatever we want. The outcome should be to build relationships as the DAO moves faster when people know each other and it helps create a more friendly atmosphere.”   Illustrations were added to the v1 governance post and a new mapping of the GitcoinDAO ecosystem was published by @Zargham. “The goal of this document is to provide a preliminary mapping of the critical operational functions of the GitcoinDAO pursuant to GitcoinDAO’s stated purpose, and in particular the interplays between the various stakeholders.”   The budget proposal for the Public Goods Funding Workstream has been put to vote and passed, making it the first workstream allocation confirmed by stewards.   The vote to ratify the “oneGTC: A $GTC Backed Economy”-proposal did not pass. The proposal thread has received a lot of feedback and input from the community. Yalor closed the topic as the deadline for the voted passed.   @Sirlupinwatson hosted a call on possible ways to improve the Gitcoin community with a discussion around the Mini Grants Community Events proposal.   The discussion of a Second Claim Window for $GTC was closed by @Yalor due to inactivity.    🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion  Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management  The budget proposal for the workstream has passed and action has been taken to push forward on a formal on-chain vote  @HelloShreyas and @AcceleratedCapital continue to make progress on a treasury vision and strategy document Grassroots efforts for onboarding have been started with the help of @Yalor, @Fred and others  @James has begun brainstorming with community members on how to push forward on GR11 round sizes  Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective)  The next call with @austingriffith and @owocki is 8/23. Sign up at moonshotcollective.space to join. A members directory with a list of new projects is being created in Notion, so that we collaborators can get to know each other and find folks with relevant skills The first moonshot build is active! We are building a tool to reward moonshot collective members p2p for their work. Join Telegram: Join Group Chat to learn more  Decentralization Workstream  A Worksteam Budget Request for the Dectralize Gitcoin Workstream has been published to the forum by @phutchins.  @owocki authored threads requesting the decentralization of Gitcoin’s hosting, Gitcoin Quests, Gitcoin Kudos, Gitcoin Avatar Builder and Gitcoin Profiles.  Fraud Detection & Defense (FDD-WG) former Anti-Sybil/Anti-Fraud   Community Monthly Tuesday 8/17 at 3pm EST   Name update to encompass the full responsibilities of the workstream. To be ratified by workstream board in the first board meeting   Confirmed MultiSig Keyholders (MSK) to function as the board and coordinator roles.   Gnosis Safe 4/7 setup with the following keyholders   MSK represent the different functions within the workstream and all stakeholders:   @DisruptionJoe - Coordinator   @Zargham  - Data Science   Angela Kreitenweis - Communication & Coordination   @tjayrush - Data Operations   @bobjiang  - Community Contributors   Andrew Penland - Academic Oversight   @lefterisjp - Gitcoin Users   Budget Proposal  Move Blockscience contract from Gitcoin Holdings Hire DisruptionJoe full-time to DAO Provide funding for decentralized rewards for contributors Proposal to be posted early next week for voting to begin by 8/15    Mapping the workstream gov forum post by Jessica Zartler   Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream   Visuals on some of the Gitcoin DAO Governance Process v1 parts were shared by @seedphrase with more to come. A broader map of the Quadratic Lands is in the works.   The website for the Workstream is under construction   Onboarding designers and contributors,   That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance, feel free join the discussions via the links and on Discord! Previous Edition
We updated the FDD-WG open call date to 8/17! I think we got that update on here after the post went up
Thanks for mention Scott  I just added details about the first Unconference session to the post. @ceresstation would you mind adding this event to GitcoinDAO calendar ?
For sure! Just adding it in now.

discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #12

content.content: This weekly post has the ambition to summarize what’s been going on in the Gitcoin DAO Governance. Topics, ideas, proposals, and votes will be listed with links for further reading and discussion. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance    One year after the community rallied behind the grant to fund the research and implementation of EIP1559, Tim Beiko and the team have now sent back the extra funds to the matching pool! Due to the price increase of ETH and a generous donation by the EF the team is sending back more than double the amount they raised in USD terms; $200,000.   The proposal for CLR Fund to receive 40k GTC has passed, acting as the first major “impact” (non-operational) funding decision in the DAO. Many more to come.    🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion  Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management   @ceresstation posted a working document for an initial list of KPIs / high level goals for the Public Goods workstream.   @krrisis and @linht.tran have started formalizing the library into a weekly discussion group, bringing in high quality speakers from across the ecosystem to discuss how we can think more deeply about the values we’re looking to push forward in the space   @jihad has started giving some thought to how to structure the fundraising champions substream and start building a group of engaged funder’s league members   Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective)   @metahands authored a proposal to “seek the community’s support for creating 3D versions of each MoonshotBot, and then making the files available as free downloads for MSB holders.” A 3D model prototype can be viewed by entering the password: publicgoods.   @owocki gave out a golden keyboard on behalf of the collective during Gitcoin’s attendance at MCON   Decentralization Workstream  All UI designs for dGrants POC have been built and are being merged today Successfully deployed dGrants to Rinkeby Base structure for dGrants documentation created and deployed using docusaurus   Fraud Detection & Defense (FDD-WG)    @DisruptionJoe authored a thread titled FDD Grant Approval Policy for DAOs to have a “productive discussion around what criteria should be considered and what the thresholds should be for inclusion”. @Huxwell replied with insight on the template and methods used by Protocol Labs. Discord support channel open spots (contributors)! - We (GitcoinDAO) need you, if you are:  The existing gitcoin.co user and familiar with grants/bounties etc. Love to help others to answer their any questions related with gitcoin Passion to grow gitcoindao   Apply this position (Gitcoin DAO Onboarding) → input “discord support” as your 2nd question answer.  Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream  The MMM-Workstream has published a Q4 budget proposal for review, feedback is welcome! A Gitcoin DAO newsletter is spinning up from the copywriting substream of MMM. The Newsletter is intended to keep Stewards and the broader GitcoinDAO Community up to speed on the most relevant discussions and proposals from the past week. The tone is casual and a quick TL;DR that hits your inbox once a week. A second iteration of Memepalooza is being planned to take place at the end of the month. The event is a collaborative experiment to create and celebrate great memes on the topics of public goods, web3 and the values of Gitcoin DAO together with the broader community.  That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance. Feel free to join the discussions via the links above and on Discord, and visit the Gitcoin DAO Event calendar to keep yourself updated on what’s to come! Previous Edition

discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #7

content.content: This weekly post has the ambition to summarize what’s been going on in the Gitcoin DAO Governance. Topics, ideas, proposals, and votes will be listed with links for further reading and discussion. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance    The first on-chain vote for paying out GTC to GR10 “Building Gitcoin” participants was put live by @austingriffith. More information here   An initial DAO Onboarding Typeform was put together by @DisruptionJoe and @ceresstation to help new participants get engaged.   The Gitcoin Grantee Content Creation + Storytelling-Workstream proposal by @thealexyao has been updated after feedback from the community. @ken and @Pop are continuing to provide guidance to iterate towards a version to be put to vote.   @owocki authored a thread on how Gitcoin/GitcoinDAO Egregore is Emerging. The post is “designed to provide some food for thought on Gitcoin/GitcoinDAO - where it’s been, where it is not, and where it’s going.”   The first Gitcoin Stewards Unconference Chat by @Anett will be held on Aug 18th and continue on a monthly basis.   @Developer-piyush posted a RFP on GitcoinDAO for climate change and proposed the formation of a Climate DAO.    🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion  Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management  The public goods discussion group held its second meeting to help onboard new contributors and get more people thinking about public goods in the context of @ceresstation  and @Toby’s  call to action. The first workstream budget by @Yalor has passed and is waiting to be put on Tally for on-chain ratification.  Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective)  The budget proposal put forward by @austingriffith and the Moonshot Collective workstream for Q3 2021 passed and action has been taken to push forward on a formal on-chain vote.  Decentralization Workstream  The vote for the Decentralize Gitcoin Workstream budget is live with a deadline on Aug 17th. The requests made by @owocki to decentralize Gitcoin’s hosting, Gitcoin Quests, Gitcoin Kudos, Gitcoin Avatar Builder and Gitcoin Profiles has received multiple proposals from the community.  Fraud Detection & Defense (FDD-WG) former Anti-Sybil/Anti-Fraud  A budget request proposal to fund the FDD-WG workstream for Q3 2021 was posted by @DisruptionJoe. The workstream is ramping up for GR11 to ensure robust fraud detection  Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream MMM is currently working on a number of starting projects:  A new public goods merch website Steward cards to help the community understand Map of the quadratic lands Onboarding new team members and increasing Meme VelocityTM  That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance, feel free join the discussions via the links and on Discord! Previous Edition

discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #2

content.content: This is the second edition of our weekly post with the ambition to summarise what’s been going on in the Gitcoin DAO Governance. Topics, ideas, proposals, and votes will be listed with links for further reading and discussion. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance    Anett and Yalor are continuing to help steward meta-governance in their thread aimed at increasing the transparency of Stewards Calls by posting details and notes. The post outlines the agenda for the #1 monthly Gitcoin DAO Steward Call that will take place on the 5th of July.   The formal proposal introducing Gitcoin Seasons by fireeyes, _​:fire:, last week has sparked a more general conversation after a post by lefterisjp on how Stewards should be compensated.   A new but related proposal was put forward in parallel to ratify a one-time allocation for GR10 and “incentive to help dogfood grants which support the GitcoinDAO”.   Toby, Simona, Ken, and others are actively working towards an updated governance process including a more precise definition of workstreams to help frame the discussion around workstream specific compensation.   Discussions around the unclaimed tokens from the GTC airdrop continue to be active in two threads 1 & 2. Yalor provided a summary of the discussion.   Bobjiang shared an update on the Gitcoin Chinese Ecosystem after their first group meeting earlier in the week.    🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion  Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management   Gitcoin Grants Round 10 was a huge success. Owocki started a thread on Grants Data Round over Round with dashboards and stats of the Grants Rounds.   The Gitcoin Building Gitcoin round showed off a range of projects in the GitcoinDAO ecosystem, if you have a project that you’d like to include in the next round please add it!   The discussion around what constitutes a public good continues. Among other questions, pet3rpan started a proposal discussion around whether VC backed projects should be included. Defining rules for inclusion in grants rounds seems like a strong priority.   Progress on executing the Akita vote continues, with Austin Griffith creating a website app that lets Gitcoin approve certain amounts of Akita to be sold at the current market price.   Shreyas and others are continuing to draft a first version of a treasury management strategy to be executed by the Public Goods Funding workstream.   The BrightID team and others have noted issues with rounds going over saturation resulting in incorrect match amounts (the point at which matching calculations according to QF exceed the funds available in the matching pool) and are writing a proposed solution.   Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective)   First pass of the website is live with shiny new designs being shared across Figma files.   The workstream will kick off officially at EthCC in Paris the week of 7/19, anyone with ideas for prototypes that help push public goods forward is encouraged to join.   Decentralization Workstream   Philip has closed out the architecture phase (including the tech stack) and begun development of decentralized grants independent from the core team.   A GitHub organization and repositories have been created for anyone to track progress.   The grant for further funding the decentralized grants workstream has been very successful raising over $30k with matching.   A discussion about what responsible data stewardship on the existing Gitcoin.co marketplace looks like was started by Owocki.   Anti-Sybil Workstream   Recruited community members and stewards to participate in evaluation of users for sybil behavior to train the ML algorithm.   Performed statistical analysis to estimate percentage of sybil accounts. This is used to determine accuracy of the ML algorithm. The machine learning group found the estimated fraud tax from GR10 to be 14.5k, which is down from GR9’s $33k. This is a 2.05% taxation quotient.   Grant Disputes have been cataloged in a public Notion and automated to show on the GitcoinDisputes twitter.   DistruptionJoe wrote up the closing steps and ratification process for Grants Round 10. Check it out on the Governance Forum.   Working on sybil-resistance mechanism design with Moonshot Collective & Decentralizing Grants workstream.   Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream   Initial mockups of a map of the quadratic lands have been started to help new participants navigate the GitcoinDAO ecosystem.   Fred and Chris are continuing to push forward the meme contest in partnership with Stateful Works.   That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance, feel free join the discussions via the links and on Discord!
Thank you so much for taking on the work of assembling this. It really helps.

discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #13

content.content: This weekly post has the ambition to summarize what’s been going on in the Gitcoin DAO Governance. Topics, ideas, proposals, and votes will be listed with links for further reading and discussion. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance    @owocki authored a thread on Gitcoin Grants Side Rounds. Side rounds are “typically for ecosystems that are Ethereum-adjacent, and they are run during the same time as the main Ethereum round every quarter.”.   @Sujiyan from Mask Network proposed a “token swap between $MASK and $GTC to further diversify both treasuries and strengthen the interaction between our communities.” The post on strategic token swaps on the MaskDAO forum can be found here.   @AcceleratedCapital added more information to their thread on Gitcoin Treasury Vision; “We are currently in the process of creating financial reporting and doing some legal work with Gitcoin Holdings on how best to implement these decisions”   @owocki shared an “overview post about Gitcoin, so that prospective DAO participants know the why/what/how of GitcoinDAO” in a thread titled TLDR - What is Gitcoin? [Updated Sept 2021].   @alisha replied to the discussion around What are the KPIs that GitcoinDAO Optimizes for with thought on ways to measure ecosystem impact with three main areas of importance; Impact of Discoverability, Community and Matching.   @krrisis did a quick revision of the GitcoinDAO homepage to make it easier for new contributors to find their way around. He also created a new typeform which will help us evaluate new contributors more easily.   The proposal to Issue a 40k Grant to CLR.Fund will soon be live on Tally to get ratified onchain.    🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion  Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management  First public goods bi-weekly ops call is coming up starting this Wednesday for those interested in joining the Public Goods Workstreams. These are the roles we are currently looking for. Check our link to learn more! There is increasing interest in finding ways to run side rounds via Gitcoin Grants for independent ecosystems, discussions are taking place on how to do this in a way that maximizes benefit for the public good. The public library has started to become a key place to jam on public goods related topics, the group is discussing starting a shared Mirror publication. RFP initial winners and honorary mentions are set to be announced in the next week.  Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective)  Every Friday the Moonshot Collective gets together to show off their progress. Individual projects demo what they’ve been working on, and this week we had five projects demo. Key demos include Open Signal, Tip Party, Tokenstream, Scaffold Directory, and the Figma Community Design Kit. Demo videos for each project can be found on  the YouTube playlist. Follow @MoonshotCollect onTwitter for frequent updates. Learn more by saying hello in Discord, or checking out our Website.  Decentralization Workstream  A new team member from the community has joined our team! This new member was found through a Gitcoin hackathon and built a prototype of the Curation Game. dGrants has added compatibility for Polygon and has deployed the dGrants contracts to the Polygon network. A closed demo is planned for the Moonshot Collective workstream this coming Monday where we will show off what we have built and ask for feedback over the next few weeks as we implement fixes and add polish to the dGrants product   Fraud Detection & Defense (FDD-WG)    @DisruptionJoe authored a thread on Threats to the Success of GitcoinDAO on the series of open workshop sessions FDD will be conducting to “identify threats & weaknesses of the GitcoinDAO during the first couple weeks of October.”. If you want to attend please add your availability to this group calendar. GR11 ended last week and @DisruptionJoe authored a thread on Expected Timeline for Completion, Ratification, and Payout of GR11 Matching Funds with information on “what needs to be done and when grant creators can expect payouts.”  @erich added to the conversation on FDD Grant Approval Policy for DAOs with a link to a “Pol.is conversation on this issue that we can leverage to find rough consensus with the community.”  Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream   The Budget Proposal Request for Q4 2021 is up for review and feedback on the forum. In order to move forward with the budget feedback from more Stewards of the DAO is needed.   The Steward Report Cards are live! The Steward Report Cards provides the most valuable metrics on engagement for each Steward in the Gitcoin DAO. The cards aggregate public data from Discourse, governance participation and workstream involvement and calculate an overall Health-score. The project will be explained in more detail in an upcoming forum post by the workstrea.   The second iteration of Memepalooza will take place in Discord on Friday. Memepalooza is not a contest - it’s a collaborative jam session and a celebration of meme lords and great memes on the topic of public goods, web3 and the values of Gitcoin DAO, and it’s super fun!   That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance. Feel free to join the discussions via the links above and on Discord, and visit the Gitcoin DAO Event calendar to keep yourself updated on what’s to come! Previous Edition

discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #8

content.content: This weekly post has the ambition to summarise what’s been going on in the Gitcoin DAO Governance. Topics, ideas, proposals, and votes will be listed with links for further reading and discussion. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance    @Pop posted an updated v2 of the Gitcoin DAO Governance Process that clarifies certain terms/sections and includes several of the comments from v1.   The Llama DAO Members @HelloShreyas, @AcceleratedCapital authored a thread on Gitcoin Treasury Vision that “aims to outline and ratify a treasury management framework that aligns with Gitcoin’s values and mission”.   @lefterisjp posted a proposal to Issue CLR.Fund a 40k GTC Grant. @auryn from CLR-fund provided more details on how the funds would be used.   An AMA with @owocki on The Gitcoin/GitcoinDAO Egregore is Emerging-post was hosted on Discord as it’s been generating some discussions.   @Sirlupinwatson posted a summary of the last two weeks in regard to the progress of the Mini Grants Community Events.   The first Gitcoin stewards unconference chats was hosted by @anett on the 18th. The ambition of these calls is to have “non formal chat together, share memes, share whatever we want. The outcome should be to build relationships as the DAO moves faster when people know each other and create a more friendly atmosphere in DAO.”   A couple of bounties in the currently running Decentralized Governance Hackathon from Gitcoin and GitcoinDAO workstreams are up for grabs by the attending hackers.   The five RFPs on decentralizing parts of Gitcoin authored by @owocki continue to draw attention with an increasing number of applicants.   The gitcoindao.com site has launched as a first point of contact for new members of the community as well as a place to keep track of everything that’s going on in GitcoinDAO.    🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion  Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management   The first workstream budget has been passed and is waiting for execution on Tally!   Seeking a New Kind of Public Good has concluded, and led to a number of participants interested in helping push the workstream forward!   We are actively seeking new members to help with onboarding and moderation, if you’re interested and want to earn some governance rights please reach out!   Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective)  Moonshot Collective had our prototyping engine turn over for the first time this week! Our first project, Quadratic Diplomacy, has tokens flow through it according to member votes, and this working prototype is a landmark first victory for Moonshot Collective!  Decentralization Workstream  The vote to ratify the Decentralize Gitcoin - Workstream budget request for Q3 2021 has passed and action has been taken to push forward on a formal on-chain vote. Created spec for decentralized curation that will seed experimentation builds through a hackathon as well as the Moonshot Collective. Starting conversations around utilizing the composable pieces of dGrants in other systems like clr.fund as well as utilizing pieces of projects like clr.fund in dGrants.   Fraud Detection & Defense (FDD-WG)   Coordination Substream  Contributor Management  29 apps / 6 contributors onboarded  Brainstormed and setup onboarding flow & added to Notion  Hosted Community Open Call Event - Notes / Video Onboarded three substream leads & setup 6 more initial calls   Accounting  Setup diagram showing intended mechanism design for dRewards Early   New FDD Workstream Calendar setup The vote on the Budget Proposal for Q3 2021 is live on Snapshot until 8/22  Proposal passed on snapshot and is in que to be posted to Tally Mural diagram of dRewards value flow   Notion setup with Actions & tasks for accountability & internal comms plan Potential name change to “Blue Team Workstream”   @David_Dyor authored a thread with a poll asking the community what name they prefer for the workstream.      Anti-Sybil Substream (Danilo/Blockscience)  Building microservices to support a 12 hour cycle time for continuous updates from the ML algorithm to QF results Prototyping a user interface for improved human evaluation experience Designing feature set pipeline for continuous updates to the model    Data & DevOps Substream (Philip Hutchins)  Initial call to define scope Short/Medium/Long term Onboarded initial contributors Discussed cross-stream collaborations with dGrants & Moonshots Standing up new DAO GCP, Github, Microservices for Anti-Sybil Developing strategy to maximize availability of data to the community without compromising PII including cGrants, dGrants, Gitcoin users, etc.    Research & Policy Substream (TBD)  Open Science Research  Started Planning -GR11 Research sprint to find mathematically optimal scoring system for curation game generating Sybil score   Choosing a coordinator next week Grants policy  Clarified policy connections from cGrants to dGrants Developing a dispute resoluiton mechanism design with sanctions following Ostrom’s 8 principles   Legal  Multiple submissions for legal advisors on retainer for DAO as part of the dRewards stream      Support  Working with Bob Jiang to develop stream deliverables for Q3 Assess feasibility of launching with unfunded substream Plan to stand up and then spin our the support stream    Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream   MMM is coordinating with The Moonshot Collective to run a first external test-run of MC’s first projects; Quadratic Diplomacy.   A mapping of the Quadratics Lands is being finalized together with a couple more visuals for the Gitcoin DAO Governance Process.   The workstream has soft launched a website at https://www.m-m-m.xyz/. The site is currently pointing towards the workstream page on Notion as the website is being built out.   That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance. Feel free join the discussions via the links and on Discord and visit the Gitcoin DAO Event calendar to keep yourself updated on what’s to come! Previous Edition

discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #3

content.content: This is the third edition of our weekly post with the ambition to summarize what’s been going on in Gitcoin DAO Governance. Topics, ideas, proposals, and votes will be listed with links for further reading and discussion. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance    The Gitcoin DAO Steward Monthly was held on July 5th, Yalor and Anett shared the agenda, a recording of the meeting, and notes.   Simona, Toby, and Ken have put forward an updated DAO governance process for review and ratification.    🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion  Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management   A proposal discussion authored by DisruptionJoe asks Community Stewards to ratify the GR10 payout amounts as being correct, fair, and abiding to community norms, including the judgements and sanctions made by the Anti-Fraud Workstream.   The website app by Austin Griffith that lets Gitcoin approve certain amounts of Akita to be sold at the current market price has been tested to burn and sell ~6% of total AKITA   UBIpromoter started a discussion around how grant matching estimates during Grants rounds can be improved to display more accurate numbers. Owocki shared data on how match estimates changed over time during GR10, by round.   Yalor gave an update In the thread on a second claim window for GTC stating that discussion “has not garnered enough support to even get to a proposal stage”.   A community call was held on July 6th to discuss the stablecoin introduced by Lior. The ICHI team has begun working on a TL;DR-version of the value proposition of oneGTCto the Gitcoin community. A Telegram group chat has also been created for further discussion.   Spugpow proposed ways of implementing regular opinion polling of grant contributors that would allow contributors of grants to signal whether they are satisfied with how the project has used their donation or not.   Shreyas is continuing to push forward a holistic treasury management strategy for review.   Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective)   MoonshotCollective.space is live and we are collecting emails for our first meeting which will be after EthCC. Kevin and Austin are “announcing“ the MoonshotCollective at EthCC   Initial components and starter kits are also being hacked on so they can have some good examples at the first meeting   Decentralization Workstream   Development on the prototype has begun. You can see the beginnings of the GrantRegistry and GrantRounds contracts in the contracts directory.   Frank Chen has joined the workstream and will be taking on some of the project and product management responsibilities.   We are tightly scoping the first iteration of the prototype build project in an effort to enable wider and more decentralized contribution.   Richard Schumann has joined the workstream and is kicking off designing the UI for the Decentralized Grants dApp.   Anti-Sybil Workstream   BlockScience published a post that evaluates their Anti-Fraud Results for Grants round 10. One of the results presented is the improvement around fraud tax: “The fraud tax for Gitcoin Round 10 was $14,400, approximately 2.1% of the total matching funds of $700,000. (…) The fraud tax in Gitcoin Round 9 was $33,000, or a total of 6.6%. (…) We have many iterations and improvements planned for the sybil detection pipeline between now and the start of Gitcoin Round 11.”   The thread on Gitcoin Disputes by tjayrush sparked a discussion on ways to improve the mechanisms used to identify and settle disputes.   Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream   The deadline for the Gitcoin Meme contest has passed and the process of picking the winners is currently underway. Winners will be invited to join a meme squad for public digital goods.   Steward Report Card designs and a general map of the Gitcoin DAO ecosystem are in progress.   That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance, feel free join the discussions via the links and on Discord! Previous Edition
It looks like you need to enter a passcode to watch the recording of the steward meeting. Does anyone know the passcode, or is the recording posted elsewhere?
Hi! The access passcode for the recording is: Dbx#yrq6

discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #14

content.content: This weekly post has the ambition to summarize what’s been going on in the Gitcoin DAO Governance. Topics, ideas, proposals, and votes will be listed with links for further reading and discussion. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance    @owocki authored a thread titled How might we Decentralize Gitcoin? The post lays out “a high level view of how we might decentralize Gitcoin from a platform into a series of protocols. This post contains much of the same information as my recent Edcon talk Decentralizing Gitcoin Grants 3.”   A thread on Stewards Voting Power over time was created by @owocki to to track how voting power of the stewards evolve over time. The code used can be found here.   The discussion on Gitcoin Grants Side Rounds received input from @linda and @David_Dyor with feedback regarding the benefits and potential risks.    🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion  Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management  First public goods bi-weekly ops call surfaced a lot of great contributors, and formalized the roles for those who have already been helping throughout the quarter. Check our link to learn more! There is increasing interest in finding ways to run side rounds via Gitcoin Grants for independent ecosystems, discussions are taking place on a few key themed rounds including climate change and advocacy as well. RFP initial winners and honorary mentions have almost finished providing their abstracts for the announcement!  Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective)   Every Friday the Moonshot Collective gets together to show off their progress. Individual projects demo what they’ve been working on, and this week we had five projects demo.   The demos included Anon Vs Moloch, Tip Party, Quadratic Diplomacy, Quadratic Diplomacy With Chakra UI, and Quadratic Diplomacy Unified Repo.   Demo videos for each project can be found on  this YouTube playlist. Follow @MoonshotCollect onTwitter for frequent updates. Learn more by saying hello in Discord, or checking out our Website.   Decentralization Workstream  Wrapping up the POC release of dGrants this week Successfully added support for the Polygon network Added support for utilizing TheGraph to index chain data and increase performance The dGrants team is running a Decentralized Grant Round on the Polygon network starting next week for the Moonshot Collectieve workstream as a way to support our DAO, stress test the system, and collect feedback from users. Product planning is being done in preparation for running a side round in GR12   Fraud Detection & Defense (FDD-WG)   Posted the Proposal to Ratify the Results of GR11 & GR11 Governance Brief  Please discuss the proposal and vote on snapshot FDD advises we discontinue paying the Fraud Tax   BlockScience shared their report on the GR11 Anti-Sybil efforts  Fraud tax is down over 50% First round we had enough human evaluators to perform statistical analysis 853 sybil accounts sanctioned   The stream presented to the multisig keyholder oversight squad with the accomplishments of Q3 and deliverables for Q4.  Current structure of FDD & how we got here The roadmap of how we will progressively decentralize Breakdown of current state of all initiatives and squads Turning it into a blog post to supplement the Q4 2021 budget proposal next week   Sending out DAO contributor agreements to all FDD participants. Recommending all DAO contributors use an LLC. Began payments to contributors!  Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream   The Q4 budget proposal for the MMM-Workstream has met the requirements to move forward and a proposal is live on Snapshot until October 9th.   Memepalooza2 was hosted by the workstream last Friday in the Discord. Over 50 people joined and created over 100 memes on the topic for public goods, the open internet and the values of GitcoinDAO. We had a live DJ playing tunes and we tested out coordination tools from Moonshot collective; tip.party and Quadratic Diplomacy.   @fred gave a presentation and shared details on the Steward Report Cards project during a demo event hosted by Moonshot Collective. A video recording of the presentation will be uploaded to Moonshot Collectives Youtube page.   That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance. Feel free to join the discussions via the links above and on Discord, and visit the Gitcoin DAO Event calendar to keep yourself updated on what’s to come! Previous Edition
RE: decentralization of gitcoin workstream, here is the dGrants demo from moonshot collective call => Decentralized Grants - YouTube

discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #9

content.content: This weekly post has the ambition to summarize what’s been going on in the Gitcoin DAO Governance. Topics, ideas, proposals, and votes will be listed with links for further reading and discussion. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance   The discussion on the proposal to issue CLR.Fund a 40k GTC Grant is ongoing with questions and answers by both the authors @lefterisjp and @auryn providing further details (1, 2, 3) on how the funding will be used. After an inflow of users demanding GTC airdrops on Discord @owocki authored a thread to adjust the Gitcoin Code of Conduct WRT Airdrops. The discussion is active in the thread with arguments on both sides, @tra38 argued for banning airdrops entirely.  @james authored a proposal on the behalf of _​:fire: to “discuss and finalize how funding allocations from the Gitcoin Grants Round 11 Matching Pool are distributed. After a successful Grants Round 10 proposal this proposal aims to continue to drive forward community-owned decisions on Gitcoin Grants rounds.”  @krrisis made a few suggestions on how we can optimize meetings by adding some structure and transparency, all feedback very welcome. A call for review of the initial treasury management strategy was put forward by @HelloShreyas    🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion  Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management  The proposal to execute and distribute 45,000 GTC to the Public Goods Funding workstream multisig according to the budget request for Q3 2021 has passed. An initial discussion around workstream bountieswas held, Jihad is working on a strategic note to propose to the community in the near future, as a way to reward current and future contributors. Public library participants were invited to join an introductory call to the Public Goods Funding Workstream, where we also discussed how the group can co-evolve post-RFP.  Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective)  The vote to ratify the Fraud Detection & Defense - Workstream budget request for Q3 2021 is now on Tally with voting to begin 8/29.  MoonshotBots was launched with 100% of MoonshotBot Minting Fees going to fund Ethereum Public Goods on Gitcoin Grants. Season 0 daily dogfooding cycle launched in lead-up to first mainnet deployments.  Decentralization Workstream  The proposal to execute and distribute 41,300 GTC to the Decentralize Gitcoin workstream multisig according to the budget request for Q3 2021 has passed.   Fraud Detection & Defense (FDD-WG)   The vote to ratify the Fraud Detection & Defense - Workstream budget request for Q3 2021 is now on Tally with voting to begin 8/28. Coordination  Contributors  Armand Brunelle to coordinate Anti-Sybil substream community involvement. Task claim system showcased in Monthly Community Call (See Video)  Onboarding flow has been automated and we have sent invitations to 112 applicants to begin onboarding calls on 8/30   Accounting  dRewards started accruing 8/23 pending budget passing vote dRewards mechanism design spreadsheet to be finalized this week     Anti-Sybil ML  Model Training Model Supervision Feature Pipeline Human Evaluation  Recruiting contributors for three squads     Data & DevOps  Data Operations Dev Ops Management  Github & GCP orgs started for the DAO - All workstreams can participate   Reporting & Analytics   Research & Policy  Open Science Program Grant Approvals & Disputes Appeals & Sanctions Legal   User Support  Knowledge Base Discord Support Localizations Ambassador Program    Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream  Preparations for the upcoming Memapalooza, that will be held on Aug 31th, are taking place. The event will be a cross-workstream collaboration between MMM and Moonshot Collective early beta testers of MC’s Season Zero projects and tools. A new developer group from the Moonshot Collective Workstream has been formalized to implement the Steward health cards. The cards will display valuable information on engagement and interactions from each Steward with the DAO and assist delegators make informed decisions.  That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance. Feel free to join the discussions via the links above and on Discord, and visit the Gitcoin DAO Event calendar to keep yourself updated on what’s to come! Previous Edition

ceresstation:  Armand Brunelle to coordinate Anti-Sybil substream community involvement.   Starting out on Monday, meetup with Lawrence and Eric from Omni Analytics! I’m pretty exited! Thanks for the mention @ceresstation, I appreciate it!      ceresstation:  Task claim system showcased in Monthly Community Call (See Video)   This is a private page in Gitcoin. Please contact the page owner to invite you to collaborate. You need some access level to view the video.
Thank you for writing those @ceresstation A small update:  The CLR.fund funding is in snapshot voting: Snapshot

discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #4

content.content: This weekly post is geared towards summarizing what’s been going on in Gitcoin DAO Governance. Discussions, proposals, and key initiatives will be listed with links for further reading and review. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance    Simona Pop alongside Ken and Toby authored a thread on the suggested Gitcoin DAO Governance Process v1. The post is intended to fill in details from v0 and kickstart discussion around the different roles, flows and pathways so that we can ensure the effective and smooth operation of everything we do in this community. Please comment if you haven’t already!   Yalor put forward an initial workstream budget for the Public Goods Funding workstream in line with the v1 governance process   A proposal by amsos presents ways to improve Gitcoin governance with Outcome-Based Donations (OBDs) to “enable a bottoms-up governance model and creates a positive-sum game where Stewards and Stakeholders work together.”   Bobjiang shared an update on the Gitcoin Chinese Ecosystem after their second meeting.    🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion  Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management   Public Goods Funding Workstream Call #2 took place Monday to review some of the recent decisions and plan next steps. If you’d like to be on the next one, please send a message on Discord!   A vote to ratify the results of Grants Round 10 and request the community to payout matching allocations was put forward and passed!   A secondary GR10 vote to reward the first “Building Gitcoin” round participants with GTC was moved from forum discussion to Snapshot vote after the 5 day window by James Waugh.   The discussion on $oneGTC - a stablecoin for the Gitcoin community continues to be active with Lior diving deeper into the details on how the stablecoin would work.   Sirlupinwatson shared a proposal draft for Mini Grants Community Events to “learn, get involved or improve the wider Gitcoin community.”.   Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective)   Kevin and Austin will be announcing Moonshot Collective at EthCC in Paris next week. Sign up at that site to be involved!   Several eager new workstream members have already been onboarded after showcasing initial prototypes they’ve been working on   Decentralization Workstream  Automated testing has been added to the dGrants repository in order to provide faster feedback and ensure high quality code GrantRounds contract has been created and merged. We are beginning work on a factory contract. Wireframes for a bare bones UI are being created independently of the current existing minimal UI The workstream is adding two developers from the Gitcoin Engineering team at 50% capacity  Anti-Fraud & Collusion   Reformatted data in Gov Forum post to be easier to read in response to questions from stewards. The adjustments made for sybil defense are to be ratified with the current vote on snapshot. At this point, there has been no increase in users reporting issues with their accounts after 1366 sybil accounts deactivated from matching. Policy definition considerations for the platform and Ethereum ecosystem are being drafted for review & discussion by stewards to be ratified into policy prior to GR11. A post by parobov_p goes into detail on ways to turn Gitcoin into an identity provider. The post goes on to explain that Price of forgery “gives the ability to quality control human verification methods with market forces. It is unbiased, precise, and responsive to new exploits.”  In progress  Comms  Forum post to create context of “Highest Level of the DAO” mapping where this workstream and substreams interact. Welcome page for new contributors   Tech  Web service infrastructure for human participation in ML pipeline Automations for community participation in workstreams via “working channels” in Discord        Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream   The 10 winners of the Gitcoin Meme Contest have been selected and are invited to form a working group that will continue to meme for the public good and expand the reach of Gitcoin DAOs values and mission.   Workstream headers, flow charts, infographics and other helpful visuals on various parts of Gitcoin DAO are being worked on.   That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance, feel free join the discussions via the links and on Discord! Previous Edition

discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #1

content.content: This will be the first edition of a weekly post with the goal of summarizing what’s been going on in Gitcoin DAO Governance at the end of every week. Topics, ideas, proposals and votes will be listed with links for further reading and discussion. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance     Community members are continuing to express interest in becoming Stewards in the DAO and govern for the public good with introductions rolling into the Steward Governance thread. No formal criteria have been set on becoming a Steward aside from interest in participating at this time.   Several Stewards have begun drafting a version of formalized rules for governance based on existing rules found here. It is expected that these will be ratified in the coming weeks, after a hectic start given some unexpectedly complex votes around Gitcoin Grants treasury management.   The deadline for claiming GTC tokens ended this week. 97% of all tokens were claimed and the remaining tokens have been transferred to the Gitcoin DAO treasury for future use by the community.   Some members have suggested a second claim window using the funds in the treasury given the tight 30 day window for the first distribution. Join the discussion here!   A formal proposal around season-based compensation for Stewards has been put forward by Fire Eyes, _​:fire:, for community review. Callum describes seasons as “a time period for Gitcoin Stewards to earn GTC for active participation in governance. It consists of the top 40 delegated addresses, with an open application process for community members to join.”    🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion + Proposal Updates   Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management   Andrew’s path forward for AKITA was ratified by the community after healthy debate, and several stewards (Austin, Trent, Andrew, and Avsa) are working towards executing next steps.   GR10 matching pool allocations were ratified on Snapshot with overwhelming agreement around the proposed categories.   A proposal to “Use Gitcoin to build GitcoinDAO’’ was passed and an open call for grants was started by Owocki. If you haven’t created a grant you still have time!   Peter Pan asked an important question around whether VC funded projects should be included in grants rounds moving forward. Discussion is still ongoing.   Lior proposed a native medium of exchange for the Gitcoin community.   The $SACKS LP position was successfully transferred to GTC treasury for safekeeping   To start, for simplicity, the DeFi Treasury Management workstream has been formed as a subset of the Public Goods Funding Workstream. Shreyas has begun working on a general values statement and strategy for treasury management expanding on his post here.   Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective) Austin announced that the Prototyping Workstream is now transforming into the Moonshot Collective, the first call is scheduled for July 19th at 12pm MST (invites can be found at https://moonshotcollective.space) Active Projects:  Some interesting work being done around quadratic trust - a QF tool where you fund with your clout instead of your money Gitcoin.dance - an NFT dance off for funding public goods, is targeted for GR11 SACKS launched last month, has raised $250k for public goods, and is still kicking (pun intended). Song a day man did a song about the project. Bondable, an incentivized jobs board is being worked on (see Andrew’s grant / forum)  BurnVendor), an initial interface for burning Akita to get the ETH necessary for the LBP is in progress  Projects that are more highly visible on Gitcoin Grants are more likely to be funded. A discussion around the decentralization of Gitcoin Grants Discovery was started by Owocki. Decentralization Workstream   Phutchins provided an update on Decentralizing Gitcoin and describes the progress as “Over the last week we’ve made some great progress on the Architecture Proposal and are nearing completion of the initial draft. Most of the big pieces are getting clearer and are falling into place.”   Furthermore, a new thread and a form was created to help guide community members who wish to contribute to the decentralization of Gitcoin.   Anti-Sybil Workstream  The Anti-Sybil workstream has put forward a helpful guide for anyone looking to get involved. Click Here to Inquire About Participation in This Workstream   Ops, Comms, Edu  Clarified the workstreams participants and status Hosted a full workstream Zoom on Tuesday, June 22nd  Grant Verification  Oversight of the grant verification process is now publicly available here  Recruited 4 community members approved by Workstream to participate in reviewing new grant applications & oversight of Gitcoin denials. Began defining policy for both the Platform & Eth rounds. Working to draft clear in/out of bounds territory. Documenting “gray”zone cases for review  Detection of Sybil/Fraudulent Behavior  Continued experimentation of specificity vs sensitivity of algorithm Human evaluation of algorithm for training data continues  Appeals, Sanctions, and Evolving Policy  Work has begun with the coordinator role being assigned A first draft of an appeals process has been made for grants and users Rough consensus formed on using an English common law standard of precedents and appeals to update the policy  Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream  Chris Martz announced the MMM workstream, described as “a small creative team operating in service of Gitcoin / GitcoinDAO, it’s wider community and it’s values and goals. […] Using merch, memes and marketing MMM will create unique public goods, new projects, fun stuff that generates curiosity and hype around public goods, Gitcoin, open source software”.  That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance, feel free join the discussions via the links and on Discord!
Support, actively participate in community self-governance, put forward more reasonable recommendations and guidelines, let GTC community become FHA
Great update! This is very helpful.
Thank you for this update, its quite helpful.
Kudos. The update is on point. Sybil is a major issue and it’s very technical to deal with. With time, GTC community will win over it.

discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #5

content.content: This weekly post has the ambition to summarize what’s been going on in the Gitcoin DAO Governance. Topics, ideas, proposals, and votes will be listed with links for further reading and discussion. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance    The thread outlining the Gitcoin DAO Governance Process v1 has sparked an active discussion with questions and improvement suggestions on various parts.   An in-person stewards meet-up took place at EthCC! Topics including how to improve incentivization, deliberations, and accountability of the DAO Stewards were brought up. @krrisis provided notes for review.   The Public Goods Funding workstream has put forward an initial draft to formalize their efforts and request a governance reward budget of 45,000 GTC to be deployed over the next 3 months. Discussion is ongoing in the thread.   @austingriffith and @owocki put forward a budget request  for 40,000 GTC to fund the Workstream through the next 3 months. Please comment!   @thealexyao proposed a new workstream titled “Gitcoin Grantee Content Creation + Storytelling” to “re-engage grantees who have graduated from Gitcoin Grants and create a formal process for them to tell their stories.”.    🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion  Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management   A vote to ratify the allocation of GTC from the Community Treasury towards grant recipients in the Gitcoin builds GitcoinDAO category of Round 10 passed! A Tally vote to distribute the funds and execute on the proposal is in progress.   @Yalor authored a new thread regarding the community stable coin $oneGTC previously introduced by Lior. The proposal will be open for discussion for 2 weeks leading up to the next Gitcoin Stewards Call August 2nd, with a snapshot vote that will be up soon and open until August 3rd.   The discussion on Mini Grants Community Events is ongoing with more details provided by the author @Sirlupinwatson.   @DisruptionJoe provided some insights on the effort to decentralize grants and allow the community to run and verify the calculations for Grant Rounds payouts.   @HelloShreyas and the team at Llama have started making progress on a unified treasury management strategy with the hope that the public goods funding workstream budget will be passed to help fund their work.   The topic of establishing a ruleset for potential tokens being gifted the Gitcoin DAO treasury in the future got some new attention after posts by @Sirlupinwatson and @php.   Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective)   @owocki and @austingriffith formally introduced the Moonshot Collective at EthCC with a presentation titled It’s all Coordination.   The kickoff call for the Workstream was a success with a large number of attendees. A recording of the call can be found here, the deck can be found here.   A budget request to fund the Workstream through the remainder of the year was put forward by Austin and Owocki.   @austingriffith posted a request for help with general ops, meetings, website maintenance and making sure things get completed.   Decentralization Workstream  Created the GrantRound Factory contract here  Workstream budget proposal created and in review Deciding on project licensing this week We are having in depth discussion around how payouts will work here    Anti-Fraud & Collusion    Coordinator vacation this week   The adjustments made for sybil defense were ratified on snapshot. At this point, there has been no increase in users reporting issues with their accounts after 1366 sybil accounts deactivated from matching.   Policy definition considerations for the platform and Ethereum ecosystem are being drafted for review & discussion by stewards to be ratified into policy prior to GR11.   A post by parobov_p goes into detail on ways to turn Gitcoin into an identity provider. The post goes on to explain that Price of forgery “gives the ability to quality control human verification methods with market forces. It is unbiased, precise, and responsive to new exploits.”   In progress:  Comms  Forum post to create context of “Highest Level of the DAO” mapping where this workstream and substreams interact. Welcome page for new contributors   Tech  Web service infrastructure for human participation in ML pipeline Automations for community participation in workstreams via “working channels” in Discord.      Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream   A visual mapping of the Gitcoin DAO Governance Process v1 is being worked on and will be published by the workstream soon.   Header arts for the five current active Workstreams as well as steward cards that will help both stewards, delegators, and contributors navigate the DAO are in the works.   That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance, feel free join the discussions via the links and on Discord! Previous Edition

discourse_list.title: Gitcoin DAO - Week in Governance, Edition #10

content.content: This weekly post has the ambition to summarize what’s been going on in the Gitcoin DAO Governance. Topics, ideas, proposals, and votes will be listed with links for further reading and discussion. If there’s anything missing please reach out!    Meta-Governance   A vote to issue a 40k GTC grant to CLR.fund is up on Snapshot after two weeks of discussion. A vote by _​:fire: is live on Snapshot to ratify the GR11 Matching Pool Allocations proposed and discussed in this forum thread. The discussion following the proposal authored by @owocki to Adjust the Gitcoin Code of Conduct WRT Airdrops is ongoing. @tra38 authored a new thread to discuss how a ban on airdrops could be enforced with active discussion.  @owocki authored a thread on GitcoinDAO META: Coordination (of Culture + Capital).  @kyle provided some details in the discussion on Gitcoin Round 11 Matching Pool Allocations with stats from previous grants round with SE Asia subcategories. @tjayrush added a summary of the proposed changes.  @owocki authored a thread to highlight open positions in the Workstreams. @ceresstation posted a link to the new onboarding Typeform for GitcoinDAO contributors.   🧙‍♂️🧙‍♀️ Workstream Discussion  Public Goods Funding / Treasury Management  The transaction from the Gitcoin DAO treasury towards funding for the Public Goods Workstream has been executed on-chain! The treasury management doc by @HelloShreyas is still up for discussion, please leave comments! Judging for the public goods RFP continues with some excellent submissions so far Discussions are starting to take shape around how DAOs at large should define the kinds of public goods they care about, in the context of Uniswap’s side round and other current events Some new Discord bots / community management tools are starting to take shape  Public Goods Prototyping (Moonshot Collective)  @ThomasCrown authored a thread called Moonshot Bot Gifting Program with the question; “How do we incentivize additional mints and strong sales for MSB, to maximize their usefulness as public goods funding tools?”. Our biggest visible accomplishment this week is the ramp-up to launch tip.party We’re also upgrading the tech, content, and team behind scaffold-eth We’re putting together a media strategy, more on this soon! We’re building a foundation of scalable pipelines and playbooks, the results will be invisible, but have many knock-on effects that help keep our project velocity high  Decentralization Workstream  The transaction from the Gitcoin DAO treasury towards funding for the Decentralization Workstream has been executed on-chain. The first MVP of decentralized grants is close to completion to be showcased for a “Gitcoin Building Gitcoin” side round!   Fraud Detection & Defense (FDD-WG)   Updated all FDD events on add-event calendar with new zoom links (please delete and resubscribe to current events if you already had it)! New contributors are starting to be onboarded in preparation for Grants Round 11 defense Blockscience continues to put out great research, this time on the role of algorithms in governance  Merch, Memes, Marketing Workstream  The first Memepalooza event took place in Discord this week. The event was a collaboration between Moonshot Collective and MMM. The MMM Workstream onboarding experience for new contributors has seen an overhaul with a new Typeform. A second Typeform to request memes, merch, marketing or anything between, is also live.  That’s it for this week in Gitcoin DAO governance. Feel free to join the discussions via the links above and on Discord, and visit the Gitcoin DAO Event calendar to keep yourself updated on what’s to come! Previous Edition
